results.title: Selling America
results.creator_credit: General Motors and Jam Handy Organization
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of Benjamin Franklin’s principle of human association as applied to modern salesmanship. The following rules for successful selling are suggested: Get the prospect talking; don’t argue but be pleasant and helpful; agree with the customer, answering “yes…, but…”; don’t contradict and avoid being too positive; make the most use of time, bringing points of direct interest to the customer with other points about the product.

results.title: Sell Yourself : Successful Job Interviewing
results.creator_credit: Kier M. Cline, Barbara Arrigo, Cinema Video Center and Learning Seed
results.brief_description: Going through a job interview is a nerve-racking experience for most of us. This video teaches you the skills needed to present yourself well and win a tough job interview. Over a dozen common interview situations are re-enacted in a dramatic and often humorous way to show you how not to proceed as well as how to impress your interviewer, from the moment you arrive to the moment the interview is closed.

results.creator_credit: Bruno Bozzetto and Bruno Bozzetto Films
results.brief_description: Bozzetto’s satirical cartoon about a group of enterprising mosquitoes. An allegory of how capitalism works against conservation.

results.title: Self defence by plants
results.brief_description: A study of the various self-protective characteristics which are found among plants, including the early seed case, the bud scales and leaf hairs, and the different methods of protection used by leaves and flowers against damage by rain and animals.

results.title: Self construct
results.brief_description:
“Self Construct” explores the personal feelings of a young woman grappling with notions of self identity. The work explores complex ideas of exteranl /internal constructions of “self”. She asks the question - Where does ones identity come from?

Fontaine uses a cut up graphic style to to reflect her sense of dislocation and alienation from others.

Perceptions of memory and thought, interpretation and meaning, are all ideas explored in this innovative and thoughtful work.

“Self Construct” was awarded The Managesoft Award for “Best Final Year Interactive Project ” in the Victoria University BA multimedia course in 2001.

“Self Construct” is also a finalist in the Mayne Award for Multimedia Adelaide Festival Awards for Literature.

results.title: Self-portrait. Parts 1-5
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An anthology of scenes from memorable National Film Board films produced during the years from 1939 to 1960. Text on the screen identifies the film and its makers before each excerpt is shown, and the commentator notes the significant characteristics of each film’s style and subject.

results.title: Self-help
results.brief_description: Villagers in Malaya, living in widely separated huts open to attack by terrorists, clear a new site and move their village to an area more easily protected by police and their newly formed Home Guard unit.

results.title: Selective breeding
results.creator_credit: Ron Lea and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Investigates the deliberate breeding of particular characteristics into different animals. Discusses the idea that many fashionable characteristics can lead to animals which are not functional. Also looks at the breeding of horses and chickens with breeders outlining some of the methods used to produce or maintain particular characterisitics.
Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Selections from the Christmas Oratorio by J.S. Bach
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Montreal Bach Choir under the direction of George Little has sung in many countries. This film presents the choir in one of its most distinguished performances with guest soloists Elizabeth Benson Guy, soprano; Maureen Forrester, contralto; Glenn Schnittke, tenor; Jan Simons, bass; James Ranti, trumpet; and Calvin Sieb, concertmaster.
